summary: No .bat files, no editing, no console commands. Tired of PRESET race stats. Now you can change them! Change your starting skills levels, race ability, and your initial 35 skill levels to anything you want with any race
descriptionHtml:
==========================
Complete Custom Race Stats
==========================
Complete Custom Race Stats is designed to let you RE SPEC your character anyway you want. Allowing you to choose your racial ability, what your base skill levels start at ( 0 or 15), and let's you pick where you want your 35 initial skill levels points to go.

*MUST START A NEW GAMEPLAY!
*Complete Custom Race Stats is triggered after the character creation menu and before the executioners block. When your standing in line.

==========
FEATURES
==========
- Reset Skills to 0 or 15
- Choose Any Race Ability
- Re Spec your initial 35 skill points for ANY class to any combination of skills you want.'
- No .bat files, no console commands, ALL menu based.

===================
STAT CALCULATIONS
===================
Some users where confused on how the stats are set. I hope this explains it better.
Based off of vanilla preset stats, all races start with a base of 15 in each skill. Each race also has predefined stats increasing certain skills based on the class selection example(Nord starts with +10 in two handed. This makes two-handed 25. the base + 10)

Complete custom race stats does the same thing, except allowing you to choose what you want.
You select the BASE number (0 or 15). Then when selecting your skill levels.....lets say you choose 10 in alteration and you chose 15 as your base stat
the base(15) + the number you choose(10) = 25. So your starting skill level would be 25 for alteration. Now...you have only used 10 points, you still can use another 25 points into other skills.

SOOOOO....

BASE SKILL LEVEL + AMOUNT YOU WANT TO ADD = STARTING SKILL LEVEL

=========
THANKS
=========
If you enjoyed my mod please endorse it!
author: ThieFsrevenge

files.name: Complete Custom Race Stats
files.changelogHtml:
When confirming your skills, if selected the \"no\" option skills were not being reset correctly. This issue has been fixed
When confirming that option \"no\" was selected. The player can now reset the base level stats as well.
